sentence.idiomatic: He decorated his new home very imposingly.
So he's your boss! No wonder he was dressed so imposingly.
This could be an imperial garden, it looks so imposing.
Our factory's production facilities are very advanced.
He is in charge of the company's equipment management.
The laboratory needs to purchase some new instruments.
This model cell phone is rather common in the market.
A person as straightforward as him is not at all common these days.
There are many foreigners that can speak Chinese, but ones that can sing Beijing opera are not at all common.
Our new product passed national quality certification.
Government employees partaking in the exam must pass qualification authentication before they can take the written test.
Some companies, when recruiting employees, demand that they undergo education verification.
This company was founded by us, the three partners.
Formerly, he had participated in the founding of quite a few magazines.
After returning to China, she established a language school in Shanghai.
The scope of the mall is very large, and its merchandise covers the whole spectrum.
This earthquake was not large-scale. So far there are no casualties.
This year's film festival surpassed all previous years' in scope and popularity.

word.literal: to be unable to support financially

sentence.idiomatic: Gas prices have risen, and while many people can afford to buy cars, they just can't afford to use them.

word.literal: to be unable to support financially

sentence.idiomatic: My wife just loves spending money. I can barely afford it.

word.literal: to be unable to support financially

sentence.idiomatic: There are too many government employees these days. The government can't afford to keep them all.
The company decided to hire him as CEO.
People with bad work attitudes aren't likely to get hired even if they have the capabilities.
Companies that hire laid off workers can enjoy governmental subsidies.
The company made a rule that late employees would have their pay docked.
Unmarried men and women cannot live together. Which law is that from?
The government has stipulated that Spring Festival, Labor Day Holiday, and National Founding Day Holiday each get seven days' vacation.
Peter, welcome to our factory for a tour.
Mr. Li, thank you for your reception. The factory buildings are very imposing!
Not bad, hey! This is what we invested 80,000,000 in last year to build.
Even overseas you don't often see facilities like yours.
I can do something or not--but if I'm going to do something, I will definitely do it the best. We've had ISO certification for a long time now.
Mr. Li, when was this factory established?
Over ten years ago. In the beginning there were only a few people. Now, however, we are one of the largest tool manufacturers in the country.
Really amazing. How many employees do you have?

word.literal: to not be able to support

sentence.idiomatic: Over 300. In your country, Canada, a factory definitely would not be able to support that many people.
You're right. But, I've heard that the cost of employing laborers in China is high now too.
Yeah! That's all because of the labor benefits stipulated by the government. You just ignore them and then it's fine.
Won't that cause problems?
Well, what can I do? If I did things according to how they say I should, I would have closed down a long time ago.
Huh?
